turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Please, what else could it mean?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: So if you give us the pregnant lady's number, we can warn her about the lake and she'll live long enough to have the baby.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: So let's do it.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What about that?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: How you doing in there, hero?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: What are you doing?  You're going to kill us!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: No.  If anyone dies from a crash now, it'll be me.  But I can't die if Eugene and Isabella are still alive.  I'm last on Death's list.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Are you crazy?  What makes you think you'd survive?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What happened when Eugene tried to kill himself out of turn?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Six duds in a row.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: And when it was Rory's turn to die, and Thomas was in the way?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: This makes no sense.  Isabella was supposed to crash her van into a lake.  Could we have altered her destiny when we had her arrested?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: I don't think so.  Alex's premonitions happened exactly as he saw them no matter how much we tried to change it.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: What did you see?  What am I looking for?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: No, it's not here.  This one was different.  More like the pile up and the van going into the lake.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Another premonition?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Yes.  I was in a hospital.  There was screaming... A nurse was choking me.  I couldn't tell what she looked like, but the name tag was right in my face.  Kalarjian.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Speed up.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Yeah, fuck 'em.  No offense.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: What did you see?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I was dead.  And came back to life. An EEG machine.  Where's Eugene?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: No!  It can't be.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: I have to save Eugene!

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: A mortician.  He seemed to know a hell of a lot more about death than he ever told us.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Should we knock?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: He probably already knows we're coming.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Remember the onramp?  There was a pregnant woman in a white delivery van.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Holy shit.  He said "only new life can defeat death."  If she gives birth to a baby that was never meant to be born, a brand new soul that was never part of Death's Design...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Make sure all these people will be at the meeting tonight.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Taken care of.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Here we go.  The vehicle's a delivery van registered to Jorge and Isabella Cruz.  And Christ, there's almost a dozen domestic disturbance complaints on these two.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: We need to hurry.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Then the only way to survive is to get to the hospital and protect Eugene and Isabella for as long as we can.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: If only Alex and I had done that with the others, Alex might still be...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: A guard grabbed me before I could find Eugene.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Don't sweat it.  It's over.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: She had the baby?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Jury duty?  That's randomly selected by social security numbers.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Random, sure.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: What, you think Death planned for each of us to die in the pile up weeks ago?  You're nuts.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Um, Clear?  I'm sorry...about before. I...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Your entire world view just went out the window.  I couldn't expect a religious conversation overnight. We'll get through this.  I promise.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm not sure I understand.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Being alive after our time caused an outward ripple - a rift in Death's design.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: So if you never got off the plane, none of us would be alive in the first place.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: That's why Death is working backwards. It's tying up all the loose ends, sealing the rift once and for all This chapter of the screenplay contains scene that do not appear or occur elsewhere in the final movie. In order to maintain the integrity of the screenplay, it has not been edited.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: The only reason he was on Route 18 was because he own the lottery and had to collect the winnings.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: That lucky bastard.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: What about the rest of you?  Kimberly, you were driving to Daytona.  Was Route 18 your first choice?

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: I had tickets to go, but one day I'm in Paris, trippin' on acid, sippin' lattes an' such, and this dude gets whacked by a falling sign.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Carter.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Freaked me out so bad I hid in a shopping cart for four hours. 'Course, missed the show...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: What about you, Kimberly?  Did you anyone from Flight-?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Dano, shouldn't we go back and help your mother?

turns.speaker: DANO
turns.text: Blow me.

turns.speaker: DANO
turns.text: Calm down, Kimmy.  It's not drugs, just weed.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Yeah, you should have specified.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: A Trans Am.  That shit went out with New Kids on the Block.

turns.speaker: DANO
turns.text: Yeah.  Who does he think he is? Knight Rider?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Dano, shouldn't we stop and help your mother?

turns.speaker: DANO
turns.text: Blow me.  Yellow means go, Kimberly.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Dano, shouldn't we stop and help your mother?

turns.speaker: DANO
turns.text: Blow me.  Yellow means go, Kimmy.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SUBY
turns.text: Tell me you didn't start up on that Flight 180 shit again.  Did you?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Of course not.  That would be irresponsible and unprofessional.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Look, you weren't there.  It was weird.  She knew that log truck was gonna cause an accident, she knew.  Never mind.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SUBY
turns.text: I thought we were finished with this bullshit.  This is police work, not the psychic Hot Line.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: You've made your point.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SUBY
turns.text: Good.  Cause we just got some new info and I don't need you getting freaky on me.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE SUBY
turns.text: Evan Shaeffer's dead.  Guess he wasn't as lucky as we thought.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: What do you mean "grand theft auto?" This is insane.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Hopefully the district judge can straighten it all out by Monday morning.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Jorge.  When I get out of here I'm going to sue his cheating ass off.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Damn, they always stick me with the clunker.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Take my van!

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Please.  It's not going to wait.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I've got to stop and help those people.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Do you want to deliver this baby?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I'm Officer Burke.  I'm looking for an Isabella Cruz.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Are you Jorge Cruz?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Maybe.  What's this about?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: May we come in?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: No.  What's this about?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: We had a fight.  Some things got broken, the dog went crazy, she left me.  Wouldn't say where she was going.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: What was the fight about?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: Take a guess.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Does she have a cell phone?  A way we can contact her?

turns.speaker: JORGE
turns.text: She did.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: First I'm stuck with Jury Duty, now this nonsense.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Yeah, I hate to love and leave ya, but I've been over this X-Files shit since the sixth season.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: This can't be happening.  My career's at a peak, I finally met a cute guy, I just bought a new house...

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Just shut the fuck up and maybe you'll live.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Last July I dialed a wrong number and got a radio station by accident. They asked me what number means "good luck" in Jewish.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Eighteen.  And it's "Hebrew".

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Anyway, I guessed it right and won these.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Here's what I don't get.  For nine months, Death does all this shit to make sure I win these tickets and end up on Route 18 at exactly the right time for the pile up...

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: But why single me out?  What am I in the great scheme of things?  You'd think I stepped off Flight 180 or something... Fucking weird, man.

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I got that beat.  So like, last May, I was supposed to stay at this cheesy bed and breakfast in Pennsylvania. There was a major gas leak no one knew about and all the guests suffocated during the night.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Yeah, so what happened?

turns.speaker: KAT
turns.text: I never mad it.  The Greyhound bus I was on splattered some chick all over the road and we had to stop.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: What's going on here?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: There's going to be a pile up.  Logs. Bodies everywhere.  I saw it happen. It happened.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: THAT's the truck that's going to kill everyone!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Alright miss, calm down.  I just need this lane open.  I need you to pull your vehicle onto the shoulder!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You're not listening to me!  You have to do something!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Tell me again how it started.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Like I said, it was like I was there. I remember everything.  The sounds of the crashes, the smells, the look on Shaina's face...

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Do you remember what triggered it all?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: The log truck...and everybody I guess. Everyone was driving like a maniac. And somehow I knew something horrible was going to happen, even before it did.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Billboards about accidents.  Kids yelling "pile up" for no reason. It all felt...just wrong. Just like...

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: You mean Alex Browning.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: ...My Premonition was just like his.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I tried calling last night but your father --

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Evan Shaeffer's dead.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I know.  I've gotten calls all morning from everyone who was on the onramp. We're all meeting at my apartment tonight.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Then you believe all this??  That Death is working off a list?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I didn't.  Until I was dispatched to clean up one of the Flight 180 survivors.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Clean up?  I don't...

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Pigeons... It's a sign!  If Clear's right about the order, then Nora and Tim are going to be attacked by Pigeons!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I'm not following you --

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: They're next on the list.  We have to find them.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Turn around.  The cleaning woman said they're at the dentist's. 14th and Main.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Hold on.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Nora's not coming.  She refuses to leave her son.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: We have to tell her she's in danger!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I did.  And right now, I don't think she cares.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: This is cheery.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Who is this guy, anyway?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: New life defeats death?  Follow the signs?  Where the hell did you find that guy?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Yeah, I thought he was supposed to be helpful.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: It throws the entire Death list out of whack.  And a new list has to be rewritten from scratch.  We all start over with a clean slate.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: It sounds all well and good, but what if we're wrong?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Shit, I don't have her number.  She was never interviewed.  She took off right after the accident.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: How are we going to find her?  There must be thousands of white vans in this state.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Hey, I'm a police officer, remember?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Whoa, nine months?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Guys, let's not panic.  Isabella's safe.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: You said she was going to drive into a lake.  How can she when she's in protective custody?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Stop it, don't move him!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: He can't breathe damn it.  I think his lung's collapsed!

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Um, Kimberly?  This is a neighborhood. You may wanna slow it down.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Don't worry.  Nothing can happen to us.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I wasn't worried about us.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Kalarjian?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I think a nurse named Kalarjian is going to choke Isabella to death!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Shouldn't we pull over?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: No time.  Keep going.  I wouldn't know how to explain any of this anyway.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Are you okay?  You just face planted!

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I know how it feels to be dead.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: But it's over.  Isabella's baby was the key.  You saw her die and everything, right?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I don't...what if I made a mistake?

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Impossible.  She was on the onramp.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I'm not sure... I don't think Isabella was ever destined to die in the pile- up.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Then what's the premonition of the lake supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You can't cheat destiny.  I know what I have to do to save us.  I have to die.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: That's crazy.  You can't give up now.  We can still fight this thing.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Welcome back.  We did it.  For real.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: I know.  I can feel it too.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: For God's sake, leave him alone, Dad.

turns.speaker: THOMAS
turns.text: Yeah, don't make me cite you for harassment.

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: Want me to drive?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: No, I'm good.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: This trip better be worth it. What's the guy-girl ratio again?

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: Get ready to smile, five guys per girl.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I can live with thaaaa --

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: What's the chance of finding a nice mature guy once we get to Daytona?

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: How does a nice mature fuck sound?

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: What is it?  What are you?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: There's going to be a huge accident! Everyone's gonna die.  All of us!  I saw it!

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: What is it?  What are you?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: There's going to be a huge accident! Everyone's gonna die, all of us, I saw it!

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: Relax, you need to chill the fuck out.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Highway to Hell, Highway to Hell.

turns.speaker: SHAINA
turns.text: For Christ sakes girl, take a breath.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: More than that.  All the songs on the radio were about car crashes. Some kid's banging toy cars together.  She was dialing her cell phone with her headset on.  His car was leaking oil all over the road.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Hey, don't be knockin' the Chevette.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: The best way to get to Yankee Stadium is Route 18.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I don't know what's weirder, the dialing a wrong number part or that Death would set you up nine months in advance.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: When I die.  Is it gonna hurt?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I...I don't know.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: And you're gonna die after me, right?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: RORY
turns.text: Would you take these?  And if I die...  Could you throw all my drugs out? Paraphernalia, porno, you know... Anything that would break my mom's heart.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Thanks, Dad.  I'll call you.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: You have everything, Kimberly? Credit card, cell phone, AAA card?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Relax, Dad.  It's Daytona, not Mongolia.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: Fix-A-flat?  Road flares? Sunblock?  Mace?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I know this is the first time we've been apart since.  But everything's gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: I know, honey.  I just --

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: Your mother would have been so proud of the way you've handled yourself through all of this...

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I know, Dad.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: Kimberly?  It's Dad.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: Hey, Dad.  What's up?

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: Your car's leaking either transmission or brake fluid.  I want you to have it checked ASAP at a gas station.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: You got it, Dad.  I'll call you if I have a problem.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: I mean it.  Take care of it.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I will, Dad.  Bye, luv you.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I know it's crazy, but I'm really scared for the others.  I've got this terrible feeling.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: What feeling?

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: That it's not over yet.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm just so happy that you're safe.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I love you too, Dad.  Goodnight.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: There were so many times I didn't think I could last another day.  I can't even tell you some of the things I thought about.

turns.speaker: KIMBERLY
turns.text: I used to have those feelings, too. But that's when I'd think of Mom. Her strength...and courage.  And I'd pray that maybe I'd grow up to be as brave as she was.  And the bad thoughts would go away.

turns.speaker: MR. BURROUGHS
turns.text: I don't know what I'd do if I lost you.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Damn, it really hurts, Mom.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: I know, we'll be there soon.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: What on Earth are they doing?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Who am I, David Blane?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You're all certifiable, you know that?  I can't believe I've been listening to this crap.  Come on, Tim, let's go outside.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Jeez, Mom, stop trippin'.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Mom?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: You think... You think those guys were b.s.-ing us today or what?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: You think the tooth fairy's gonna come tonight?  I'm thinkin' like fifteen bucks.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Nice try, kiddo.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: How would I know? You think I'm some sort of...

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: He's not a witch.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: It's only the end of June.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Yeah, but everything's always in transition. If you focus, even now, one week into summer... you can feel Autumn coming.  Almost like bein' able... to see the future.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: You went there? I've wanted to go there, but I thought it was off limits.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: It is. But that didn't stop me. Shouldn't stop you.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Not a likeness. It's how you make me feel, Alex.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm... really sorry.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Like you, the sculpture doesn't even know what, or why, it is. Reluctant to take form. And, yet, creating an absolute but incomprehensible attraction.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: That's why I was there last night.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I've never dealt with death before. I wasn't alive when my grandparents died. I wish I could know. I mean, all this... could just be in our heads. Now it feels like it's everywhere.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: "It?"

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What if Tod... is just the first... of us?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Is that something you're "feeling?"

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I don't know. I wish I could just see him... one more time, then, maybe...  I would know.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Then, let's go see him!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: This place?!

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Doin' somethin' I'm not supposed to.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: That... him?

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: I think. But why'd they make him up like... Michael Jackson?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: That's him, but... he's not here.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Ahhh! fuck! You fucking asshole. You think this is funny, you fucking dick? Tod, if you're not dead I'm gonna fucking kill you!

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: Ohmygod! OHMYGOD!  OHMYGOD!  He's not dead?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: He said Death has a design. Even before he said that I had been seeing patterns.

turns.speaker: CLEAR
turns.text: As in flannels and plaids?
